senses.de: To say no to something or someone

Tips.title: Personal Decisions
Tips.description: Used when someone makes a personal choice to decline something.
Tips.example: He rejected the job offer after considering his family's needs.

Tips.title: Implicit Reason
Tips.description: Often implies there's a reason for saying no that may not be explicitly stated.
Tips.example: She rejected the invitation, hinting she was busy.

Tips.title: Not Always Negative
Tips.description: Rejection might lead to a better situation or offer.
Tips.example: They felt relieved after rejecting the risky deal.

senses.de: To not accept because it is not good enough
senses.ex: The university rejected her application due to low scores.

Tips.title: Quality Standards
Tips.description: Suggests something did not meet a required standard or expectation.
Tips.example: The editor rejected the article for its lack of depth.

Tips.title: Performance-Based
Tips.description: Often associated with academic or job applications where criteria are not met.
Tips.example: His poor performance led the team to reject his candidacy.

Tips.title: Opportunity for Growth
Tips.description: Rejection can imply a chance to improve and try again.
Tips.example: She improved her skills after her proposal was rejected.

senses.de: Something or someone that is not accepted
senses.ex: This shirt is a factory reject because of its misplaced buttons.

Tips.title: Faulty Items
Tips.description: Refers to items that fail quality checks and are not sold as first-hand goods.
Tips.example: Marked as a reject, the flawed toys were discounted.

Tips.title: Distinction in Use
Tips.description: Used more in commercial or industrial contexts to describe faulty goods.
Tips.example: The machine stamped the incorrect parts as rejects.

senses.de: In medicine, a body rejects a new organ when it attacks it because it looks like foreign tissue.
senses.ex: After the transplant, the patient's body started to reject the new kidney.

Tips.title: Medical Specific
Tips.description: In medical contexts, it's about the body’s response to foreign entities.
Tips.example: Despite medication, her body began to reject the donor heart.

Tips.title: Not Always Immediate
Tips.description: Rejection in medical transplants may occur weeks or months after surgery.
Tips.example: The symptoms suggested a late-stage rejection of the implant.

Decline.wordDefinition:
Decline means to politely refuse or say no to something, usually due to a reason or circumstance. For example, if someone invites you to a party but you have to study for an exam, you can decline the invitation by saying "Thank you for inviting me, but I have to study for an exam.".

Decline is used for politely turning down something due to a reason, while reject is used for forcefully refusing something you don't like or agree with.

Deny.wordDefinition:
Deny means to refuse to admit the truth or existence of something, while reject means to refuse to accept something.

For example, if someone denies that they stole something, they are saying that they did not do it. Whereas if someone rejects a gift, they are declining to accept it.

Deny can also be used in more serious situations, such as when a person denies committing a crime.

Dismiss.wordDefinition:
Dismiss means to reject or deny something or someone, but it can also mean to disregard or ignore something or someone.

The main difference between the two words is that dismiss can be used in a broader sense than reject, which is more specific to saying "no".

Neglect.wordDefinition:
Neglect means to fail to care for or pay attention to someone or something properly. This is applicable when someone or something is not given the necessary attention it requires for it to function properly.

For example, if a plant is neglected, it will not be watered and cared for causing it to die.

Refuse.wordDefinition:
Refuse means to say no to something that is being offered or asked for. For example, if someone offers you a piece of cake and you don't want it, you can refuse it.

To summarize, refuse is used when you want to say no to something that you simply don't want or need, while reject is used when you want to say no to something that doesn't meet your standards or expectations.

Repudiate.wordDefinition:
Repudiate means to deny or disown something that you previously accepted or supported. For instance, if you had previously endorsed a political candidate, but later learned about something unethical they did, you might repudiate your support and publicly announce your change of heart.

Reject is used to refuse something upfront, while repudiate is typically used when someone changes their mind about something they previously supported.

Snub.wordDefinition:
Snub means to reject someone in a disrespectful or dismissive way, often through actions rather than words. For example, if you try to talk to someone at a party and they turn away from you and start talking to someone else, they are snubbing you.

Reject is a general term for refusing, while snub involves actively and disrespectfully rejecting someone.

Spurn.wordDefinition:
Both reject and spurn mean to refuse or decline something, but spurn carries a stronger notion of disdain, disgust, or contempt.

Reject is more neutral and can imply a reasoned decision. For example, you can reject an offer to go to a party because you have to finish your homework, but you can spurn the advances of someone who you find repulsive or disrespectful.

Hence, reject is a more general term, while spurn implies rejection with a negative or insulting attitude.

Turn down.wordDefinition:
Turn down also means to refuse or say no to something, but it implies a gentler or more polite way of doing so.

It can be used in situations such as turning down an invitation, turning down a request, or turning down an offer that one is not interested in.

To put it simply, reject is a more direct and firm way of saying no, while turn down is a softer and more polite way of doing so.

quotes.Text: I spent so many years being repeatedly rejected and told I wasn't good enough. It took a huge toll on my self-esteem until I realized I am more than my body and that, actually, our beauty comes from diversity.
quotes.Title: English Model
quotes.Name: Iskra Lawrence

quotes.Text: In my journey, I got amazing characters to play which were as interesting as a lead role. In 'Commando,' my role was so good. I feel no actor have rejected that kind of a role.
quotes.Title: Indian Actor
quotes.Name: Jaideep Ahlawat

quotes.Text: The whole secret of existence is to have no fear. Never fear what will become of you, depend on no one. Only the moment you reject all help are you freed.
quotes.Title: Indian Clergyman
quotes.Name: Swami Vivekananda

quotes.Text: Social media has changed our lives forever. Some continue to reject social media, refusing to become one of the sheep, but you just can't avoid it.
quotes.Title: Ecuadorian Politician
quotes.Name: Fabrizio Moreira

quotes.Text: Everyone has the right to practice their religious beliefs in private but expect that people might publicly reject said beliefs.
quotes.Title: Canadian Scientist
quotes.Name: Gad Saad

quotes.Text: The thing that bothered me when I was in college was that I saw myself rejecting the way of life that got me to where I was.
quotes.Title: American Judge
quotes.Name: Clarence Thomas

quotes.Text: Civilization is merely an advance in taste: accepting, all the time, nicer things, and rejecting nasty ones.
quotes.Title: American Writer
quotes.Name: Katharine Elizabeth Fullerton Gerould

quotes.Text: Wisdom too often never comes, and so one ought not to reject it merely because it comes late.
quotes.Title: American Judge
quotes.Name: Felix Frankfurter

quotes.Text: Pain and death are part of life. To reject them is to reject life itself.
quotes.Title: British Psychologist
quotes.Name: Havelock Ellis

quotes.Text: When I wrote my first book, 'Koolaids,' I felt rejected and not wanted.
quotes.Title: Lebanese Artist
quotes.Name: Rabih Alameddine
